catalogue.message: Views or downloads generated by bots
Users responsible for this step are able to accept or reject incoming submissions. However, they are not able to edit the submission's metadata.
Users responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, and then accept or reject them.
Users responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, but will not be able to reject them.
Users responsible for this step are able to accept or reject incoming submissions. However, they are not able to edit the submission's metadata.
Users responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, and then accept or reject them.
Users responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming submissions, but will not be able to reject them.
1. Where do you want to put a new Statlet?
There are no results available for the selected datasets. Please use a different configuration.
Click on a cell below to modify its content

Please select at least one bitstream

The server did not respond in time. Please try again.
No statistical information could be retrieved. Please try again later.
No statistics available for this object.
There was an error while generating the storage report, please try again later.
No storage report available for the search.

You can generate community related usage data on the Communities tab.
By default, data from all communities is included. Use the drop down to define a selection of communities, or to limit your selection to the most popular communities.
Define which type of usage events you're interested in, by checking or unchecking certain types.
After clicking Generate Data, the properties of your selection will be reflected in the Data and Graph tabs below.

You can generate collection related usage data on the Collections tab.
By default, data from all collections is included. Use the drop down to define a selection of collections, or to limit your selection to the most popular collections.
Define which type of usage events you're interested in, by checking or unchecking certain types.
After clicking Generate Data, the properties of your selection will be reflected in the Data and Graph tabs below.

You can generate item related usage data on the Items tab.
By default, data from all items is included. Use the drop down to define a selection of items, or to limit your selection to the most popular communities.
To define a selection of items, click Add Items after choosing Selected items from the drop-down. The Add Items dialog offers the DSpace simple search to retrieve the items you wish to include. Click the green plus symbols to include them in the selection. After closing the Add Items dialog, the added items will be shown in your selection.
Define which type of usage events you're interested in, by checking or unchecking certain types.
After clicking Generate Data, the properties of your selection will be reflected in the Data and Graph tabs below.

You can generate bitstream related usage data on the Bitstreams tab.
By default, data from all bitstreams is included. Use the drop down to define a selection of items, or to limit your selection to the most popular bitstreams.
To define a selection of bitstreams, click Add Items after choosing Selected items from the drop-down. The Add Items dialog offers the DSpace simple search to retrieve the items you wish to include. Click the green plus symbols to include them in the selection. After closing the Add Bitstreams dialog, the added bitstreams will be shown in your selection.
After clicking Generate Data, the properties of your selection will be reflected in the Data and Graph tabs below.

The most granular level of usage statistics, are the Repository Statistics.
Define which type of usage events you're interested in, by checking or unchecking certain types.
After clicking Generate Data, the properties of your selection will be reflected in the Data and Graph tabs below.

The data tab visualizes the generated data as a table.
To modify the applied time filter, and granularity of the table, click Show Options. Beware that changing the group by property from "By Month", to "By Day" might take a while to re-calculate and might produce very sparse tables if you have selected a long timespan.
Each of the cells can be modified by clicking in them.
When you are satisfied with the result, you can export the data table as a CSV file.

The data tab visualizes the generated data as a table.
Each of the cells can be modified by clicking in them.
When you are satisfied with the result, you can export the data table as a CSV file.

The graph tab visualizes the generated data as a graph.
Select a timeframe in the selector at the top left. The simple time filters (e.g. Past year) will provide you with a fast way to select a time frame. Custom allows you to select precise dates. Note that the simple time frame will snap to the borders of that frame. E.g. Past year will return statistics of the previous year and the fraction of the current year. Beware that changing the group by property from "By Month", to "By Day" might take a while to re-calculate and might produce very sparse tables if you have selected a long timespan.
Selected boxes enable you to alter the graph type, the orientation and the location of the legend. More specialized options, such as various colours, are available under the tool button.
To save your graph, right click and use Save Image as.

The graph tab visualizes the generated data as a graph.
Selected boxes enable you to alter the graph type, the orientation and the location of the legend. More specialized options, such as various colours, are available under the tool button.
To save your graph, right click and use Save Image as.

The fields above show the different properties by which items can be selected for analysis. The Primary Dataset defines a selection of items to be shown. When a property is selected all possible values of that property are shown. The primary dataset will be limited to items with one of the selected values. When no categories are chosen the number of items with each value is shown. When a category is chosen the number of items per value in the primary is shown split up by the selected values from the category.

This table displays the datasets selected above as the column and row headers. Depending on the selected analysis type, the figures will represent different properties:
For Web Usage statistics, the figures represent either pageviews or bitstream downloads. For example, top 30 bitstreams will display numbers of bitstream downloads. Top communities or top collections will show you sums of collection home or community home pages. Top country or continent, will display the sum of all pageviews and bitstream downloads for that country or continent.
For Repository Content statistics, the figures represent the number of items complying with your criteria as defined in the Data Source Selection.
All values, row headers and properties can be edited by clicking on them. Changes are immediately visible, in both the Data table, and the graph below.
A spreadsheet can be downloaded including all column and row headers and all values in the Data table above.

All updates to these settings are displayed immediately in the graph below. When you right click the image of the graph, you are able to save the graph as an image. Click "Show More Options" to edit the graph title, dimensions, background color and grid color.

The generated graph can be downloaded.
In Internet Explorer bring your mouse cursor over the image - Single click Right mouse button - from the menu select Save Picture As - Save Picture window pops up - navigate to where you want to save it using “Save In” Menu
In Firefox Bring your mouse cursor over the image - Single click Right mouse button - from the menu select Save Image As - Save as window pops up - navigate to where you want to save it using “Save In” Menu.
